author: Ted Mann
title: Amazon’s Rivals Fear They Will Lose Out on Pentagon’s Cloud-Computing Contract
text:
WASHINGTON—The Defense Department will release a revised list of requirements in the coming days for a hotly contested, multibillion-dollar contract to move the Pentagon’s data into the cloud, and it says it won’t give in on a central demand: awarding the business to a single winner.

Some computing companies vying for the cloud contract have been fighting to prevent the department from awarding the work to a single vendor, fearing that would guarantee Amazon.com Inc. the business. Already dominant in the private-sector cloud... RELATED VIDEO Is Amazon Going to Rule the World? Amazon wants to deliver everything you want to your doorstep, anywhere in the world. But the e-commerce giant faces several challenges in its pursuit of a global empire. WSJ's Karan Deep Singh breaks down the basics with the help of an Amazon delivery box.
